data.title: The Old Radio
data.statement:
You found an old radio on your grandparents attic. The odd thing is that it has no speakers or anything else. There is just a green lamp that is flashing. 
<<Your task is to output the transmitted message.>>

You shortly figure out that it transmits <<ASCII>> codes.

The radio always transmits <<three>> binary values (as strings with "0b" as prefix): The first <<two>> inputs are characters (ASCII). The third input is a checksum, which is calculated by XORing the first two values and the global checksum.
Some values have been corrupted and are now either 0b11111111 or 0b00000000. You have to use the checksum to recreate the corrupted value.

lastVersion.statementHTML:
Goal

You found an old radio on your grandparents attic. The odd thing is that it has no speakers or anything else. There is just a green lamp that is flashing.
Your task is to output the transmitted message.

You shortly figure out that it transmits ASCII codes.

The radio always transmits three binary values (as strings with "0b" as prefix): The first two inputs are characters (ASCII). The third input is a checksum, which is calculated by XORing the first two values and the global checksum.
Some values have been corrupted and are now either 0b11111111 or 0b00000000. You have to use the checksum to recreate the corrupted value.
Input
Line 1: An integer N for the number of signals transmitted by the radio
Line 2: An integer C for the global checksum (which you need to get the corrupted value)
Next N lines: Three space separated strings char1, char2 and checksum for one transmission cycle. They are formatted as binary numbers with the prefix "0b".
Output
The transmitted string
Constraints
1<output string<2048
Example
Input
3
4
0b01110011 0b00000000 0b00011110
0b01101101 0b00000000 0b00011001
0b01101100 0b01100101 0b00001101
Output
simple
